data.title: Fix spelling/punctuation in descriptions of User Settings --> JS Vali…
data.body: Minor changes to address some punctuation and spelling mistakes in the JavaScript validation setting descriptions found within User Settings.

data.title: Sass: auto-complete being shown with HTML tags right after semicolon
data.body: When editing a *.scss file (Sass/Compass), after typing a semicolon, the auto-complete list is automatically shown with HTML tags and attributes. Typing semicolon + Enter (line break) actually results in an unexpected behavior...

data.title: [python] Add .gn as a python file extension
data.body: GN is a meta-build system that generates NinjaBuild files. GN syntax is a stripped down version of python.

data.title: Proposal for separating the vscode tools from the vscode API
data.body:
Currently the vscode node module combines the tools and the vscode API into one unit, we want to decouple the API from the used modules.

Support that the vscode tools and its API can evolve separately.

data.title: A string field that doesn't fit in the hover box messes up syntax highlighting

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
If during debugging you hover over an object whose representation does not fit in the hover box, it will cut it off and apply highlighting based on that. This causes an issue when you have a string: it will cut off the trailing quotes and mess up highlighting for subsequent fields.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2777107/11564100/91e57d58-99d7-11e5-83b8-23b07528b0fa.png)

data.title: Alternative fuzzy searching
data.body:
My single biggest favorite feature with Atom, that really keeps me from using vscode all that much, is atom's amazing fuzzy searching.

They have a package [fuzzaldrin](https://github.com/atom/fuzzaldrin) that does an amazing job at handling missed characters, and just getting to the result you need with ease.

Is the vscode team open to extending how fuzzy searching works, perhaps adding an option to define an alternative scoring function, as part of a users profile?

data.title: Does commands.executeCommands('editor.action.format') work properly?
Extension should be able to contribute a task template and a user can pick a template

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Currently the Configure Task Runner action generates a large task.json file with many different task configurations, that the user has to clean-up eventually, that is,  delete the configs that do not apply.

Instead of generating one large file we should allow the user to select what kind of task that should be configured and then to only generate this one. This is similar to how we generate the launch configurations.

data.title: Can't build in Windows 10

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I followed instructions from https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/How-to-Contribute#build-and-run-from-source , but the build is unsuccessful. 
I'm using node v5.1.0, Visual Studio 2015 Community (I installed C++ build tools), MSBuild v14.0.24720.0
npm-debug.log file gives following error: 

```
21173 verbose stack Error: oniguruma@5.1.1 install: `node-gyp rebuild`
21173 verbose stack Exit status 1
21173 verbose stack     at EventEmitter.<anonymous> (C:\Program Files\nodejs\node_modules\npm\lib\utils\lifecycle.js:232:16)
21173 verbose stack     at emitTwo (events.js:87:13)
21173 verbose stack     at EventEmitter.emit (events.js:172:7)
21173 verbose stack     at ChildProcess.<anonymous> (C:\Program Files\nodejs\node_modules\npm\lib\utils\spawn.js:24:14)
21173 verbose stack     at emitTwo (events.js:87:13)
21173 verbose stack     at ChildProcess.emit (events.js:172:7)
21173 verbose stack     at maybeClose (internal/child_process.js:818:16)
21173 verbose stack     at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (internal/child_process.js:211:5)
21174 verbose pkgid oniguruma@5.1.1
21175 verbose cwd E:\Github\vscode
21176 error Windows_NT 10.0.10586
21177 error argv "C:\\Program Files\\nodejs\\node.exe" "C:\\Program Files\\nodejs\\node_modules\\npm\\bin\\npm-cli.js" "install"
21178 error node v5.1.0
21179 error npm  v3.3.12
21180 error code ELIFECYCLE
21181 error oniguruma@5.1.1 install: `node-gyp rebuild`
21181 error Exit status 1
21182 error Failed at the oniguruma@5.1.1 install script 'node-gyp rebuild'.
21182 error Make sure you have the latest version of node.js and npm installed.
21182 error If you do, this is most likely a problem with the oniguruma package,
21182 error not with npm itself.
21182 error Tell the author that this fails on your system:
21182 error     node-gyp rebuild
21182 error You can get their info via:
21182 error     npm owner ls oniguruma
21182 error There is likely additional logging output above.
21183 verbose exit [ 1, true ]
```

Git shell is giving following error:

```
C:\Program Files (x86)\MSBuild\Microsoft.Cpp\v4.0\V120\Microsoft.Cpp.Platform.targets(64,5): 
error MSB8020: The build tools for v140 (Platform Toolset = 'v140') cannot be found. 
To build using the v140 build tools, please install v140 build tools.  Alternatively, you may upgrade to
 the current Visual Studio tools by selecting the Project menu or right-click the solution, and then 
selecting "Upgrade Solution...". 
[E:\Github\vscode\node_modules\vscode-textmate\node_modules\oniguruma\build\oniguruma.vcxproj]
```

However, as I mentioned earlier, my MSBuild version is 14.0.24720.0
I tried following workarounds from \* User/Repository#Num: nodejs/node-gyp#679 :
- set environment variable GYP_MSVS_VERSION = 2015
- tried to run ```scripts\npm install --msvs_version=2015
- update Visual Studio
  But still without success.

Steps to reproduce the bug:
- install Visual Studio Community 2015
- install node.js v5.1.0
- clone repository using command ```git clone https://github.com/microsoft/vscode
- go to repository `cd vscode`
- install mocha gulp ```npm install -g mocha gulp
- run install script `scripts\npm install`

data.title: extensionHost debugging: reattach does not connect to debugServer
data.body: If I have configured 'debugServer' in my launch config, the initial launch connects correctly to the debugServer, but reloading the extensionHost (which results in a 'reattach' in VSCode) does not connect to the debugServer but starts a normal debugServer instead.

data.title: Fonts become fuzzy after zooming and scrolling
data.body:
- Zoom once using Ctrl-+.
- Click on a file to open it. Text in editor looks crisp.
- Scroll down in editor and the font of the text goes fuzzy.

I searched for emmet extension on VS CODE repository but found nothing. my current version in 0.10.3. emmet also did not work in last release but before that all was good. I want emmet badly back!

data.title: Select current line

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Basically I'd just like feature parity with Atom on this.

first ctrl+l: should select the current focussed line
repeated ctrl+l should extend the selection to the end of the next line

Currently what happens:
ctrl+l: nothing

I looked through the shortcut config and couldn't find anything to do this. I also was unable to find any action for this in the source code of vscode.

data.title: Remove name "Visual Studio" from vscode.d.ts
data.body: There is a comment on line 13 in [`src/vs/vscode.d.ts`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/vscode.d.ts) that refers to "Visual Studio Code". We should not use "Visual Studio" in the sources as the name is a customization done during the build (from [`product.json`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/product.json)). Suggest just using the term `Code`.

data.title: vscode not killing child processes
data.body: when you do child_process.spawn, the new process is a child of Code, but when Code quit the children process do not, is this intended?
